page.title: 17THE AMBULANCE SERVICE(1)
page.content: Llandrindod Wells ambulance station is situated in Quarry Lane.It is one of 12 stations which make up Powys ambulance service and is controlled by a radio centre at Newtown. Llandrindod station at present consists of a garage which holds two ambulances,together with a portakabin which is used as a rest room. In the portakabin is found a telephone,tables,chairs,fridge,sink unit with water heater,microwave oven and T.V set.Behind the garage at the present time an extension is being built which will have a storage room, toilet,shower,office and permanent rest room. The ambulance station is manned 24 hours a day with two men always on duty.One is the driver and the other an attendent to the patients.
